title: Carlos Granados Memorial Scholarship
Description:: The Carlos Granados Memorial Scholarship is available to adult Latino full-time or part-time students at Triton College.  You must be majoring in automotive and who has taken Triton College English as a Second Language courses to be eligible for this award.

title: Jack Scanlon ESL Scholarship
Description:: The Jack Scanlon ESL Scholarship is available to students who attended ESL Program for a minimum of two semesters at Triton College.  You must demonstrate financial need with strong interest in pursuing a college education by seeing a counselor, participating in career activities, attending classes and participating in Triton’s ESL activities to be eligible for this award.  In addition,  an instructor’s recommendation describing the personal leadership qualities is required.

title: Joan Lally Musker Memorial Scholarship
Description:: The Joan Lally Musker Memorial Scholarship is available to female students at Triton College.  You must have a minimum GPA of 3.0, aged 25 or older and have taken at least six credit hours to be eligible for this award.  Also, required essay must discuss your financial need and how a degree from Triton will impact your family (i.e. children).

title: Joanne and Marian Mota Memorial Scholarship
Description:: The Joanne and Marian Mota Memorial Scholarship is available to full-time or part-time students at Triton College.  You must be pursuing a degree in diagnostic medical sonography (ultrasound) or a related health care field, completed a semester, submit a required essay that clearly explains why you should be selected to receive this scholarship and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award.

title: Kay Langston Scholarship
Description:: The Kay Langston Scholarship is available to new or returning students at Triton College.  You must be an Illinois resident, agree to: work under the guidance of a mentor; select a program of study prior to or during the semester of their first award; participate in scholarship fundraisers; strive to increase your GPA each term and participate in an extra-curricular activity to be eligible for this award.  Preference given to in-district students and priority will be given to African-American and Latino applicants.

title: Saluja and Duggal Scholarship
Description:: The Saluja and Duggal Scholarship is available to full-time students in second semester at Triton College.  You must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and submit a letter of recommendation from a faculty member to be eligible for this award.  In addition, you must include and essay that shows a passion for life changing experience through education and service to the community, and describe how you will turn around personal hardships to achieve higher life goals.

title: Society of Automotive Testers Technician Advancement Scholarship
Description:: The Society of Automotive Testers Technician Advancement Scholarship is available to students who have completed at least 12 credit hours at Triton College.  You must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and currently employed in the automotive field to be eligible for this award.

title: Twentieth Century Women's Club Scholarship
Description:: The Twentieth Century Women's Club Scholarship is available to students who have completed at least 24 credit hours at Triton College.  You must have a minimum GPA of 3.0, majoring in art, music or speech and reside in Proviso Township to be eligible for this award.

title: De Vries-Visser Scholarship
Description:: The De Vries-Visser Scholarship is available to entering first-year students at Calvin College.  You must be a graduate of either Pella Christian or Pell High School and have a minimum 3.0 GPA to qualify for this award.  Selection will also be based on Christian character, promise of growth and evidence of participation and leadership in activities outside the classroom.

title: John Miller Musser Memorial Forest and Society Fellowship
Description:: The John Miller Musser Memorial Forest and Society Fellowship is open to candidates who propose a fellowship that holds promise to enrich public life in the United States by enhancing the understanding of foreign countries, cultures, and trends.  You must have a graduate degree in forestry or forest-related specialties and demonstrate an interest in broadening the understanding of forest-resource problems to humans in order to be considered for this award.

title: Science Student Award
Description:: The Science Student Award is available to students pursuing a career in science.  You must demonstrate high academic achievement, exceptional leadership qualities, and involvement with community service to qualify for this award.

title: Youth Noise Scholarship Program
Description:: The Youth Noise Scholarship Program is available to high school and college students.  To be considered, you must submit a video of up to five minutes on YouTube in which you explain why are you the best candidate.

title: Mesothelioma Cancer Alliance Scholarship
Description:: The Mesothelioma Cancer Alliance Scholarship is available to full - time students whose lives have been impacted by cancer.  To be considered, you, a parent, sibling, immediate family member, or close friend must have battled or is currently fighting cancer.  Additionally, you must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and submit a 500 to - 1500 - word essay.

title: Commercial Video Scholarship
Description:: The Commercial Video Scholarship is available to high school seniors and undergraduate students enrolled at an accredited college or university.  You must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and submit an original commercial about car insurance driving habits good or bad.  Share your video with your friends via a social networking platform to qualify for this award.

title: Tweet for Success Scholarship Contest
Description:: The Tweet for Success Scholarship Contest is open to students currently enrolled in an accredited two- or four-year college for the Fall of 2016.  You must submit a message of no more than 140 characters that explains the career goals you would like to have accomplished ten years from now.  You must also be a legal resident of the U.S. and have a minimum GPA of 2.0 to be considered for this award.

title: Asian Heritage Law School Scholarship
Description:: The Asian Heritage Law School Scholarship is available to students enrolled at an accredited law school.  You must be of Asian heritage with at least one parent of Asian ancestry and have a minimum 3.0 undergraduate GPA to qualify for this award.   A one to three page essay is also required.

title: WGU Community College Partner Scholarship
Description:: The WGU Community College Partner Scholarship is available to entering students at Western Governors University.  You must have completed an associate’s degree or be an associate's degree candidate at a partnering community college to be eligible for this award.

title: WGU AmeriCorps Scholarship
Description:: The WGU AmeriCorps Scholarship is available to undergraduate and graduate students at Western Governors University.  You must have completed a term of service with AmeriCorps to be eligible for this award.

title: Western Association of Food Chains Scholarship
Description:: The Western Association of Food Chains Scholarship is available to students at Western Governors University.  You must be an employee of an eligible WAFC partner institution and have earned at least 30 semester credits in higher education to be eligible for this award.  Special consideration will be given to students who possess a retail management certification.

title: WGU Leaders in Nonprofit Scholarship
Description:: The WGU Leaders in Nonprofit Scholarship is available to students at Western Governors University.  You must be a professional working in the nonprofit sector, and majoring in business or information technology to be eligible for this award.

title: WGU NACCTEP Scholarship
Description:: The WGU Leaders in Nonprofit Scholarship is available to students at Western Governors University.  You must have graduated from a teaching associates degree program and U.S. citizen to be eligible for this award.

title: WGU Institutional Partners Fund
Description:: The WGU Institutional Partners Fund is available to students at Western Governors University.  You must be an employee of one of WGU's institutional partners to be eligible for this award.

title: WGU Phi Theta Kappa Scholarship
Description:: The WGU Phi Theta Kappa Scholarship is available to students at Western Governors University.  You must a member of Phi Theta Kappa and have an associate’s degree to be eligible for this award.

title: ANPD Excellence in Nursing Education Scholarship
Description:: The WGU Phi Theta Kappa Scholarship is available to students at Western Governors University.  You must be U.S. citizen, ANPD member looking to earn a WGU online bachelor’s degree or master's degree in nursing or healthcare to be eligible for this award.

title: EK Insurance Scholarship
Description:: The EK Insurance Scholarship is available to students enrolled at an accredited college or university.  You must choose one of the topics offered and submit a 750-1000 word essay to qualify for this award.

title: CARiD Scholarship
Description:: The CARiD Scholarship is available to students enrolled at an accredited college or university.  You must be between the ages of 16 and 20 and submit a photo inspired by any aspect of the automotive industry to qualify for this award.  Submissions could be of your first car, custom modifications you've made, something that makes your vehicle unique, or the coolest vehicle you've ever seen.
